meanings.definition: To hold a false or mistaken belief.
meanings.sent1: Some people misbelieve that the Earth is flat.
meanings.sent2: I misbelieve that tomorrow will be a sunny day.
meanings.sent3: Don't misbelieve that eating too much candy is good for you.
meanings.sent4: Her misbelief in ghosts haunted her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The child's misbelief in Santa Claus was shattered when he saw his parents placing gifts under the tree.

meanings.sent1: He misbelieves that cats are better pets than dogs.
meanings.sent2: She misbelieves that wearing red brings bad luck.
meanings.sent3: It's easy to misbelieve that all birds can fly.
meanings.sent4: Their misbelief in their invincibility led to their defeat.
meanings.sent5: The misbelief that money buys happiness is a common misconception.
